title: Making “never break the build” scale
description: I just stumbled across a post from earlier this year by Graydon Hoare, of Rust fame. The post is about what he calls the “Not Rocket Science Rule”, which says that you should automatically maintain a repository that never fails its tests. The advantages of the NRS rule are pretty clear. By ensuring that you never break the build, you shield people from having to deal with bugs that could easily have been caught automatically.
